steps.dialogue: Look at this comparison. Why is seven-tenths greater than three-tenths?

options.text: The fraction with more total pieces is greater.
The denominator is the same, so if 7 > 3, then 7/10 > 3/10.
The bigger the denominator, the bigger the fraction.
The bottom number tells us which fraction is greater.

correct_answer.context: When fractions have the same denominator, we compare numerators. Since 7 > 3, then 7/10 > 3/10.

steps.success_path_dialogue: That's right. That explanation is correct.
